bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 167, Number 201 (Thursday, November 18, 2021)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. JACOBS of California:H.R. 6084.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Section 8 of Article I of the Constitution.[Page H6609]

item.name: Energy, Climate and Grid Security Subcommittee
Energy, Climate and Grid Security Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy.
Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text:
Energy Product Reliability Act

This bill directs the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to certify an Energy Product Reliability Organization. Once certified, the organization must establish and enforce reliability standards for energy pipelines (e.g., natural gas, hydrogen, and petroleum pipelines) relating to cybersecurity, physical security, and the coordination of delivery and availability of energy products to ensure reliable electricity generation.

bill.title: Energy Product Reliability Act

item.title: To require the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to certify an Energy Product Reliability Organization which shall, subject to Commission review, establish and enforce energy product reliability standards, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
